properties.NAME: Morning Star Café
properties.COMMENT: The café is a place common gathering place and houses a brothel. It has a private entrance from the back of the building.

properties.NAME: George Café
properties.COMMENT: Owner was police officer in Haifa until 1938, and was removed from the police when it was found that he had a relationship with the gangs. To this day, he still uses his relationships to buy weapons, so he went to work as an employee in the `Steel` company, in order to have a relationship with a group of drivers suitable for him and to implement what was required of him.

properties.NAME: Windsor inn
properties.WIKI: The German Emperor Wilhiem the 2nd stayed there when he visited in 1898
properties.COMMENT: Owner owns a licensed gun shop. In 1938 he provided the rebellion with large sums of money and weapons. He contributes to this day in getting all he can. He is publically identifies as an anti-Zionist, and has a relationship with the Criminal Investigation Department of the British Mandate Police (CID)

properties.NAME: Café at Wadi al Saleeb
properties.COMMENT: The owner of the cafe is Farid Shaban Al-Hajj Ahmed, a Muslim, about 52 years old, from the Al-Hussainiyyen Party. In days of turmoil and unrest, meetings in the Wadi Salib neighborhood are held in the café. No alcoholic drinks are available in this cafe.

properties.NAME: Café at the house of hassan tankary
properties.COMMENT: In the café, there are often meetings of the Husaynis. No alcoholic drinks are available in this cafe.

properties.NAME: A café and restaurant on Carmel Avenue
properties.COMMENT: Police arrested him on suspicion of espionage for Germany-Italy. He married a Hungarian Jewish woman, Rogitsa, who converted to Christianity. She was greatly affected in the police departments and was released from detention with her help. The cafe is a permanent place for anti-Zionist propaganda by English and Arab government employees. The café has a license to sell spirits.

properties.NAME: Lady Newton's Private House
properties.WIKI: Frances Emily Newton was an English missionary who lived and worked in Palestine from 1889 until being deported in 1938. She was a very politically active, and personnaly knew the suffragist Millicent Fawcett, Lawrence of Arabia, and King Faisal. Her writings can still be found in old New York Times volumes.
properties.COMMENT: The keeper is Nasri Runtoz, a member of the Islamic Christian Association in Haifa

properties.NAME: Central Café
properties.COMMENT: It also includes a brothel.The place is a meeting place for the mixed public, and is open in the evening hours as well. The café sells spirits under a license.

properties.NAME: Café Royal Bar
properties.COMMENT: The owner of the cafe - George Mahfouz, a Christian, the British police concentrate in the cafe, and often meetings between British policemen and Muslim and Christian youths take place in the cafe. Spirits are sold under license in the café.

properties.NAME: Victoria Café
properties.COMMENT: The common people gather in it. There are alcoholic drinks sold under license

properties.NAME: Ram Sam Café
properties.COMMENT: He was active in the 1936/39 revolution. The place is used for meetings of Muslim and Christian youth. Alcoholic beverages are sold under license.

properties.NAME: Café
properties.WIKI: Souk Al-Abyad specialized in selling leather and nuts, meat and vegetables, antiques and sweets, such as baklava
properties.COMMENT: Supporter and member of the Muslim and Christian Women Club. In the evening, the café is a place for preaching, but the violins and singing camouflage this. The café has a license to sell spirits.

properties.NAME: Royal Cafe
properties.COMMENT: The place is used as a meeting place for young Muslims and Christians. Spirits are sold under license in the café.

properties.NAME: Queens' bar
properties.COMMENT: Active member of the Christian Islamic Society. He has a gritty relationship with the British police. Often meetings are held in the café.

properties.NAME: A Café and Restaurant
properties.COMMENT: A supporter of Sheikh Al-Qassam. No alcoholic drinks are available in this cafe

properties.NAME: A Café and Restaurant
properties.WIKI: By Al-Jreena mosque (in the picture background). The picture is of from a performance of the singer Mohammed Abdel-Wahab in Haifa in 1932
properties.COMMENT: The café is a place of preaching. No alcoholic drinks are available in this café.

properties.NAME: Café
properties.ADDRESS1: Bn Al-Atheer Street 30 (next to Carmel Station)
properties.COMMENT: The café is used by young Muslims and Christians to hold meetings in the café neighborhood. No alcoholic drinks are available in this café

properties.NAME: A Café and Restaurant
properties.COMMENT: A meeting place for Muslim and Christian youth. No alcoholic drinks are available in this café.

properties.NAME: Café
properties.WIKI: By Al-Jreena mosque (in the picture background). The picture is of from a performance of the singer Mohammed Abdel-Wahab in Haifa in 1932
properties.COMMENT: The cafe is used twice a week in the evening hours for preaching. No alcoholic drinks are available in this café.

properties.NAME: A Café and Restaurant
properties.COMMENT: During the turmoil, the café always had a meeting place for terrorists by day. No alcoholic drinks are available in this café.

properties.NAME: Café
properties.COMMENT: The café is a meeting place for Christian and Muslim commoners. No alcoholic drinks are available in this café.

properties.NAME: Café
properties.COMMENT: No alcoholic drinks available

properties.COMMENT: No alcoholic drinks are available in this café.

properties.NAME: Café
properties.ADDRESS1: Ibn Al-Atheer Street 31, opposite Carmel Station, Haifa, Beit Elias Ayoun
properties.COMMENT: Sometimes there are meetings for Christian scouts. No alcoholic drinks are available in this café.

properties.NAME: A Café and Restaurant
properties.COMMENT: The cafe is a place of drug trafficking: cocaine and hashish. No alcoholic drinks are available in this café.

properties.NAME: Café
properties.COMMENT: No alcoholic drinks are available in this café.

properties.NAME: Café
properties.COMMENT: It is always a meeting place for porters. No alcoholic drinks are available in this café.

properties.NAME: Café
properties.ADDRESS1: Iraq Street 106 in the house of Haj Khalil Taha's heirs
properties.COMMENT: The house and the café are used to hold permanent encounters for Muslim activists.
